blog.title: without a filter, a man is just chaos walking

summary: Can you do a blurb about the reader and Peter Parker where she becomes pen pals with Spider-Man but she doesn't know that it is...
question: Can you do a blurb about the reader and Peter Parker where she becomes pen pals with Spider-Man but she doesn't know that it is actually Peter (because he is spider-man) and he started it because he was to shy to get to know her as Peter? Sorry if that is really confusing..
answer:
Don’t worry, I got you!


The first letter had shown up at your door on a bright, sunny day in spring. You had just gotten home from school after soccer practice, and on your doorstep was an envelope with only your name on it. Frowning, you had picked it up, brought it inside, and read it in the late-afternoon sunlight, smiling to yourself when you saw it was signed from Spider-Man.

“Dear Y/N,

I’m writing to you, hopefully it’s not too creepy. I was on patrol a few nights ago and I just can’t get you out of my head. Let me get to know you?

Spider-Man”

From then on out you became pen-pals with the hero, hoping that it was actually him. You figured that whoever it was already had knowledge of where you lived anyway, and if they hadn’t harmed you now, why would they later? You were lucky enough to have it confirmed for you when you almost got mugged one afternoon heading home from school, but a red, flying figure swooped in and knocked the perpetrator of his feet, webbing his face followed by his hands and feet. 

“Hey, Y/n!” he sounded your age, if not younger, “Friendly neighborhood Spider-Man at your service, and here,” he pulled something out the sleeve of his suit, “is your letter. Nice to see you!” and then he was gone. 

You never discovered who he was. After half of all life turned to dust, you could not help but wonder if the Spider-Man had fallen victim as well, as his letters never came. It wasn’t until there was a knock on your door one evening that you found out.

“Hi, are you Y/n?” the woman had long brown hair, and looked like a single gust of wind could blow her away.

“Yes. Can I help you?”

“My name is May Parker, did you write letters to my son?”

“Your son?”

“Peter Parker. Spider-Man.”

Peter Parker. After all of those years it had been Peter Parker, the dorky kid in your science classes, the one always seeming to miss class, that had been dropping letters on your doorstep. You couldn’t hardly feel the tear falling down your face.

“Yeah,” you swallowed, “Yeah I did.” 

spideypeach blurb night

summary: oooooo u finding out about spiderman and helping to defeat Mysterio but you suddenly dIE
question: oooooo u finding out about spiderman and helping to defeat Mysterio but you suddenly dIE
answer:
why are you like this

i’m making it stark!reader also i’m making it more of a hostage situation oof


This wasn’t the strangest predicament you had found yourself in. Sitting in the arms of some sort of villain, facing a superhero, wondering if this was the time you weren’t going to make it out alive was almost a daily occurrence when it came to being Tony Stark’s kid. For a while, you had tried to resist it, felt a swarm of pent up anger every time you were taken hostage, but at this point, you resulted to letting it happen. This wasn’t the strangest predicament, and you felt like Spider-Man had it all under control.

He was Spider-Man, for pity’s sake. Before your dad had died, he had shouted praises for the masked hero. It was almost as if he was following in your father’s footsteps. You had been assisting him in combat, all up until Mysterio had rendered you defenseless, using you as bait. 

He had his arm around your waist, and his hand pressing into your cheek. Your heart raced, but you tried to swallow your fear and keep your eyes on Spider-Man about ten feet away. He was going to get him, this would be it. Then you could go home safely with all of your classmates. 

“Last chance, Mr. Parker, or you will be losing another Stark.” 

Wait.

What?

“Peter?” you said it at him, your voice breaking. It all made sense.

“Y-yeah, Y/n. It’s me,” his masked face was bouncing between your face and Quentin’s, his mind probably racing with conflict. You inhaled.

“Peter-” 

“Last chance!” 

“Y/n, I’ve got you.”

The fear in his voice seemed to say otherwise, and all of a sudden your own fear skyrocketed high into the air. There was nothing left for you to do. Your life was in Peter’s hands.

“When I told you People were going to die, Peter,” Quentin Beck, Mysterio, panted as he said the words, “I sure wasn’t kidding.”

You had found yourself in stranger predicaments before, but that was when your dad could swoop in and know what to do. As the blinding light overtook you, it seemed impossible to blame Peter Parker for anything that happened. He was a kid, and he still had a long way to go. 

oh man this got ANGSTY 

spideypeach blurb night

title: ❝gone❞— peter parker
body:
Anon - OMG CAN U PLEASE MAKE A PART 2 OF FOREVER

Part One - Forever

Pairing:  Peter Parker x Reader
Warnings: ENDGAME SPOILERS! Reader is dead (sorry spoilers for part one), very sad peter parker ),:
Summary: Peter will never stop loving you, even when you’re gone.
Words: 1,209

Masterlist

REQUESTS ARE OPEN FOR SINNING (WHETHER SMUT, ANGST OR FLUFF; SEND ME WHAT YOUR HEART DESIRES)

It had been a month. One entire month Peter had not only lost his 3rd father figure, but also the love of his life. It hurt him to look anywhere as despite the Avengers compound having been completely wrecked due to the battle, the bits where you had spruced up greenery or grown trees or made small ponds around the surrounding area had completely disappeared.

After the avengers were rehabilitated to another minor compound, Peter would come there to train for hours and hours. Happy would have to tell Peter to stop and go home because he would have school the next day and it was 4am. Your presence had affected everyone significantly and now without you, the world did seem a little darker.

One late Friday night, Peter’s tired eyes made their way to the compound. Ready to talk to Karen for hours as he pushed himself to the limit. He should’ve done more. He should’ve helped you. Every single time he tried to sleep he couldn’t help but see your lifeless body as he tried his best to keep you here.

So as Peter was ready for the automatic doors to open to the training room, he was surprised to find it shut. This minor inconvenience not playing to how he wanted his night to go. He decided to head upstairs to hopefully unlocking it.

“Bruce, Bucky? Anyone?” Peter shouted out into the building, but nothing came of it. As he headed up to the main quarters, he saw a little note left upon the table. As Peter approached the table, a pang in his heart was forever present as he picked up the note. It had your address on it.

‘Y/N wouldn’t want you to cry over her kid. We all love you. Take a visit. – The Avengers’

Peter’s eyes began to sting with tears as he looked at the table again. There were your keys; familiar keychains strung upon it, including a Spider-man one and another with your superhero trademark upon it also. This was it, Peter stared at those keys for what felt like hours but was most likely about 10 minutes. Until he finally decided to bite the bullet. He grabbed them and pulled his mask over his face.

Peter swung through the streets, having KAREN help him with the navigation. When he arrived at your apartment door, Peter couldn’t help but just stare again.

“Peter? Why aren’t you heading in?” KAREN asked him as she too could only stare at your door. Your last name in metallic letters beneath the door number.

“I-I don’t know Karen. It-It’s like I can’t move.” Peter clenched his jaw as he tried to not cry with his mask on, but it was true. He felt like his entire body was frozen in this one spot and would be forever.

“I can help you with that Peter if you-“ KAREN starts to use her technology to move Peter’s hand to the lock, but Peter tries with all his might to fight back.

“Karen don’t.” Peter warned, a ferocity he hadn’t shown to anyone but the punching bags in the Avengers compound.

“I’m sorry Peter. I overstepped my mark.” KAREN replies, but as she does; Peter mumbles an ‘it’s okay’ and begins to unlock the door.

When the door opens he can’t help being overwhelmed by the smell of you. He lets his mask flutter away and as the smell fully hits his face, he shuts the door and just cries. Cries that he didn’t do more, cries that he wished that he was never dusted, cries that Mr. Stark wasn’t here to help him cope.

When Peter finally looked around the living room it broke his heart. Back at the Avengers compound you’d always have tons of plants; on every desk in every room. But due to recent neglect they weren’t looking in good shape. To start Peter’s journey, he thought the best thing to ease him into it was to grab the small watering can you had beside one of your bigger plants, fill it up and begin to water them. The small maintenance still made him cry as it made him remember you effortlessly doing it with your powers, but he had to salvage what life there was left of you.

Peter’s last stop was arguably the hardest. Your bedroom. And even though he thought he was finished crying; when he saw the familiar shape of how you slept still there in your bedsheets and your phone still charging on the bedside table; he felt himself tensing up. As he pressed the home button on your phone it was flooded with notifications of regular things. But the most recent ones were of Peter texting you; wishing that you were there.

He gives a small gulp and reaches into his spidey suit for his phone, calling your number. He smiled at the dorky photo of him you used as his contact photo, letting it fully ring out before a familiar message played.

‘Hi! It’s Y/N, sorry I didn’t pick up but leave a message after the beep, BEEEEP!”

Peter choked out a small sob at hearing your voice before promptly hanging up, as if you’d pick it up and hear his voicemail and he’d be embarrassed by it. Yet that would never happen.

“Peter, there seems to be something on her desk.” KAREN points out, allowing Peter to be distracted from the sombre situation he had put himself in. A blue hologram light pours out the suit and to a large open book. There were others similar looking stacked beside it, and as Peter moved the pen away; he realised it was a diary.

‘Day 1,835

Today’s the day we’re going to try and pull off this ‘Time Heist’ thing, and I can’t express how much I hope it’ll work. God I miss my friends… but I God I miss my dumb idiot Peter Parker’

Peter smiles as he sees his name, wiping away his tears as to not smudge the ink of his pen.

‘If Peter comes back, I don’t know what I’ll do with him. I’ll probably never let him go. I’ll never let him see the diaries I’ve kept for 5 years. I’ll name my saga ‘5 years crying over Peter Parker’. I would never want Peter to do that over me.’

Peter squeezed his eyes shut. Knowing exactly that was what he was doing now.

‘I’m so proud of everyone, we’ve done so much and we’re going to do so much. I don’t want to get my hopes up too much, but I can’t wait to see Peter.

Goodnight Peter Parker, I’ll see you tomorrow.

Y/N’

At your final closing statement, Peter uses his gloved hand to stop a sob escaping.

“Peter?” KAREN’s voice is soft.

“Yes- K-Karen?” He sniffs, trying to compose himself; even if it’s just an AI

“You should listen to her.” She starts, letting Peter process the information. “But I think you should also take her plants back to yours and Aunt May’s apartment. Bring a little of Y/N’s life to yours.”

“Thank you Karen.” Peter closes the book and places it on top of the 4 others that were neatly stacked beside it. “I think so too.”

Anon - OMG CAN U PLEASE MAKE A PART 2 OF FOREVER

Part One - Forever

Pairing:  Peter Parker x Reader
Warnings: ENDGAME SPOILERS! Reader is dead (sorry spoilers for part one), very sad peter parker ),:
Summary: Peter will never stop loving you, even when you’re gone.
Words: 1,209

Masterlist

REQUESTS ARE OPEN FOR SINNING (WHETHER SMUT, ANGST OR FLUFF; SEND ME WHAT YOUR HEART DESIRES)

[[MORE]]

It had been a month. One entire month Peter had not only lost his 3rd father figure, but also the love of his life. It hurt him to look anywhere as despite the Avengers compound having been completely wrecked due to the battle, the bits where you had spruced up greenery or grown trees or made small ponds around the surrounding area had completely disappeared.

After the avengers were rehabilitated to another minor compound, Peter would come there to train for hours and hours. Happy would have to tell Peter to stop and go home because he would have school the next day and it was 4am. Your presence had affected everyone significantly and now without you, the world did seem a little darker.

One late Friday night, Peter’s tired eyes made their way to the compound. Ready to talk to Karen for hours as he pushed himself to the limit. He should’ve done more. He should’ve helped you. Every single time he tried to sleep he couldn’t help but see your lifeless body as he tried his best to keep you here.

So as Peter was ready for the automatic doors to open to the training room, he was surprised to find it shut. This minor inconvenience not playing to how he wanted his night to go. He decided to head upstairs to hopefully unlocking it.

“Bruce, Bucky? Anyone?” Peter shouted out into the building, but nothing came of it. As he headed up to the main quarters, he saw a little note left upon the table. As Peter approached the table, a pang in his heart was forever present as he picked up the note. It had your address on it.

‘Y/N wouldn’t want you to cry over her kid. We all love you. Take a visit. – The Avengers’

Peter’s eyes began to sting with tears as he looked at the table again. There were your keys; familiar keychains strung upon it, including a Spider-man one and another with your superhero trademark upon it also. This was it, Peter stared at those keys for what felt like hours but was most likely about 10 minutes. Until he finally decided to bite the bullet. He grabbed them and pulled his mask over his face.

Peter swung through the streets, having KAREN help him with the navigation. When he arrived at your apartment door, Peter couldn’t help but just stare again.

“Peter? Why aren’t you heading in?” KAREN asked him as she too could only stare at your door. Your last name in metallic letters beneath the door number.

“I-I don’t know Karen. It-It’s like I can’t move.” Peter clenched his jaw as he tried to not cry with his mask on, but it was true. He felt like his entire body was frozen in this one spot and would be forever.

“I can help you with that Peter if you-“ KAREN starts to use her technology to move Peter’s hand to the lock, but Peter tries with all his might to fight back.

“Karen don’t.” Peter warned, a ferocity he hadn’t shown to anyone but the punching bags in the Avengers compound.

“I’m sorry Peter. I overstepped my mark.” KAREN replies, but as she does; Peter mumbles an ‘it’s okay’ and begins to unlock the door.

When the door opens he can’t help being overwhelmed by the smell of you. He lets his mask flutter away and as the smell fully hits his face, he shuts the door and just cries. Cries that he didn’t do more, cries that he wished that he was never dusted, cries that Mr. Stark wasn’t here to help him cope.

When Peter finally looked around the living room it broke his heart. Back at the Avengers compound you’d always have tons of plants; on every desk in every room. But due to recent neglect they weren’t looking in good shape. To start Peter’s journey, he thought the best thing to ease him into it was to grab the small watering can you had beside one of your bigger plants, fill it up and begin to water them. The small maintenance still made him cry as it made him remember you effortlessly doing it with your powers, but he had to salvage what life there was left of you.

Peter’s last stop was arguably the hardest. Your bedroom. And even though he thought he was finished crying; when he saw the familiar shape of how you slept still there in your bedsheets and your phone still charging on the bedside table; he felt himself tensing up. As he pressed the home button on your phone it was flooded with notifications of regular things. But the most recent ones were of Peter texting you; wishing that you were there.

He gives a small gulp and reaches into his spidey suit for his phone, calling your number. He smiled at the dorky photo of him you used as his contact photo, letting it fully ring out before a familiar message played.

‘Hi! It’s Y/N, sorry I didn’t pick up but leave a message after the beep, BEEEEP!”

Peter choked out a small sob at hearing your voice before promptly hanging up, as if you’d pick it up and hear his voicemail and he’d be embarrassed by it. Yet that would never happen.

“Peter, there seems to be something on her desk.” KAREN points out, allowing Peter to be distracted from the sombre situation he had put himself in. A blue hologram light pours out the suit and to a large open book. There were others similar looking stacked beside it, and as Peter moved the pen away; he realised it was a diary.

‘Day 1,835

Today’s the day we’re going to try and pull off this ‘Time Heist’ thing, and I can’t express how much I hope it’ll work. God I miss my friends… but I God I miss my dumb idiot Peter Parker’

Peter smiles as he sees his name, wiping away his tears as to not smudge the ink of his pen.

‘If Peter comes back, I don’t know what I’ll do with him. I’ll probably never let him go. I’ll never let him see the diaries I’ve kept for 5 years. I’ll name my saga ‘5 years crying over Peter Parker’. I would never want Peter to do that over me.’

Peter squeezed his eyes shut. Knowing exactly that was what he was doing now.

‘I’m so proud of everyone, we’ve done so much and we’re going to do so much. I don’t want to get my hopes up too much, but I can’t wait to see Peter.

Goodnight Peter Parker, I’ll see you tomorrow.

Y/N’

At your final closing statement, Peter uses his gloved hand to stop a sob escaping.

“Peter?” KAREN’s voice is soft.

“Yes- K-Karen?” He sniffs, trying to compose himself; even if it’s just an AI

“You should listen to her.” She starts, letting Peter process the information. “But I think you should also take her plants back to yours and Aunt May’s apartment. Bring a little of Y/N’s life to yours.”

“Thank you Karen.” Peter closes the book and places it on top of the 4 others that were neatly stacked beside it. “I think so too.”

summary:

Shuri, Peter and Loki: "THIS IS WHY MOM DOESN'T FUCKING LOVE YOU!"
T'Challa, slamming his head on...
body:
Deadpool: *Shoots the ceiling*

Shuri, Peter and Loki: “THIS IS WHY MOM DOESN’T FUCKING LOVE YOU!”

T'Challa, slamming his head on the wall: “My existence is now a meme.”

Tony, now scheduling several therapy appointments: “I am literally begging you to stop.”

summary:
I know this is meant to be a mislead that goes on to be one of Natasha's early appearances.
But it just gets that much funnier...
body:
I know this is meant to be a mislead that goes on to be one of Natasha’s early appearances.

But it just gets that much funnier when one of your fave web slingers happens to be Jessica Drew of the Ultimate ‘verse who is an ACTUAL clone of Peter Parker and does, in fact, eventually become her own universe’s Black Widow.

harley, throwing the jacket away: oh thank god

summary:
Steve: Um, what’s going on with him?
Tony: I have no clue. He’s just been making pterodactyl noises all day in response to...
body:
Steve: Um, what’s going on with him?


Tony: I have no clue. He’s just been making pterodactyl noises all day in response to everything.

Sam: Hey kid, have you seen—


Peter: rreeeEEAEEAAEEAEHHHHH—


Sam: JeSuS—*throws fire extinguisher*


Tony: oH fUcK—
